abstract: Frank H Pearl, book publisher with a zeal for serious literature, dies at age 68. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Frank H. Pearl, a lawyer and investor in Washington who entered the book business on a quest to publish the serious, quality literature that he felt large corporate publishing houses had neglected, died on Friday in Baltimore. He was 68. His death, at the Johns Hopkins Hospital, was announced by the lawyer Vernon E. Jordan Jr., a close friend, who said Mr. Pearl had lung cancer. He lived in Washington.

headline.main: Frank H. Pearl, 68, Publisher With a Zeal for the Serious
